## Course Objectives {.smaller}

- Understand basically how a computer works
- Understand the structure, primary objects, operators and other basic elements of the R language
- Understand basic concepts of data visualization
- Understand basic concepts of data munging
- Understand basic concepts of modeling
- Understand basic concepts of hypothesis testing

# Module 2: R Basics {.smaller}

{{< include ./qmd/module-2.qmd >}}

::: {.notes}
- Why R? R is an excellent language to get started with programming because it's specialized. Unlike some other languages, it doesn't have an overwhelming amount of features for you to learn.

- Vectors
- Primary objects
- Objects
- Operators (Assignment, Arithmetic, Comparison, Logical, Miscellaneous Operators)
- Precedence, Subsetting, Operators as functions
- Control flow
- Environments
- Packages - Unix Structure (We Stand on the Shoulders of Giants)
:::
